channel.title: Jakesrudolph
channel.description: RSS feed of the latest tweets from JakeSRudolph.

item.title: Father-Son Bonding Over Engineering and Raptors Basketball
item.description:
My dad tells me about his engineering job, his role and how he built up a digital software division worth millions. I’ve learned more about what he does in the past few months than the 18 years prior. We cheer for the Raptors (or yell at the TV screen when they suck).

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) November 20, 2023

item.title: In Dire Need: Jake's Plea
item.description:
I am in dire need pic.twitter.com/fcrzXrNVsj

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) November 17, 2023

item.title: Returning Home: A Surprising Cathartic Journey
item.description:
Moving back home after living away is a more cathartic experience that I expected.

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) November 20, 2023

item.title: "Discovering Joy: Writing Songs as a Life Hack"
item.description:
I feel like I discovered the worlds biggest life hack

No plans on the weekend ➡️
Write a song ➡️
Feel better

Unmotivated to work out ➡️
Write a song ➡️
Feel better

Run out of vitamin D gummies ➡️
Write a song ➡️
Feel better

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) November 16, 2023

item.title: Laughing with Mom: Stories of Sacrifice and Hope
item.description:
My mom and I laugh together over stories from when she worked at my crazy uncle’s business back in South Africa. We talk about her hopes and dreams that she gave up to move to Canada, and what she will do when she’s an empty nester.

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) November 20, 2023

item.title: DM Icon Debate: Envelope vs. Chat Bubble
item.description:
Why tf is the icon for DMs an envelope and not a chat bubble

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) November 16, 2023

item.title: Symposium Feels Like an Epic Season Finale
item.description:
Symposium felt like one of those big epic season finale episode where all the fan favourite characters make surprise appearances and team up and everything feels right with the world. https://t.co/du8nGhEVDR

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) November 24, 2023

item.title: Grateful for My Wonderful Socraticaverse Community
item.description:
I feel overflowingly gracious to have stumbled upon the best group of people I’ve ever met, and to be a contributing author to this chapter of the Socraticaverse.

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) November 24, 2023

item.title: "Discovering Self Through Understanding My Parents"
item.description:
For the first time, instead of being heads down running organization and doing schoolwork, i’ve had the space and time to learn who my parents are. To understand them, and through that, understand myself.

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) November 20, 2023

item.title: Building a Community of Meaningful Makers
item.description:
The PASSION.
The AUTHENTICITY.
The TEARS IN MY EYES.

We are of makers working on projects that are intrinsically meaningful. We are building a community of people who care.

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) November 24, 2023

item.description:

item.title: Building Community: More Than Just Hosting Events
item.description:
Building a community is more than just hosting events.

It’s about creating the social infrastructure for people to support each other. For friendship, energy, money and more to flow from person to person, compounding.

And in the best communities, everyone wins.

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) December 5, 2023

item.title: Reflections on Favorite and Disliked Years
item.description:
Year I dislike: 2020
Year I think is overrated: 2010
Year I like: 2019
Year I love: 2022
Year I feel most myself in: 2023
Year I still need to visit: 2024
Year I dream of living in: 2040
What about you?

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) December 30, 2023

item.title: Motivation Boost: Gym with a Stunning Ocean View!
item.description:
Getting motivated to exercise is 10x easier when you have a stunning rooftop ocean view from the gym pic.twitter.com/grPLUps7cd

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) December 26, 2023

item.title: "From Brain Dump to 10,000 Words: Explore the Toolbox!"
item.description:
Started as a lil brain dump and then we kept writing and writing and writing and writing.

10000 words later, the toolbox is here 😄

Read it when you get the chance!!! While taking public transit, sitting on the toilet, or even while procrastinating studying for finals. https://t.co/V0Cj5ULAuG

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) December 15, 2023

item.description:
How is 2023 almost over already!?

Guess time flies when you’re having fun

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) December 1, 2023

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) September 1, 2024

item.title: Finding Balance in Personal Change
item.description:
When there’s a part of my personality or proceds i want to change, I tend to overshoot it.

This isn’t a bad thing. It’s hard to escape interia without aiming for an extreme. But it takes a well-designed support system to know when it’s time to settle somewhere in the middle.

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) September 3, 2024

item.title: Sneak Peek: Org Design Concepts in Progress
item.description:
Lil sneak peak of some org design concepts i’m been cooking up 👀 pic.twitter.com/0ERIxjvh2h

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) September 5, 2024

item.title: Celebrating Community and Support in Socratica's Journey
item.description:
of those who came before us, who blazed a trail and created the infrastructure for Socratica that has propelled it to where it is today

of excessively helpful people who jump in to hand out pizza, tear wristbands, and clean up, truly embodying the mindset that everyone is a host pic.twitter.com/iECTmDm0nR

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) April 3, 2024

item.title: "Unlocking Growth Through a Video Game Skill Tree Model"
item.description:
My mental model for continuous learning and growth is video game skill tree.

1) Unlock new skills
2) Upgrade existing skills

(concept art from @socraticainfo event host archetypes) pic.twitter.com/c3isvUU3mc

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) September 1, 2024

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) April 3, 2024

item.description:
Thanks to @sohambasu963 and @Shahanneda for reminding me this existed

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) September 1, 2024

item.title: "The Power of Community in Unlocking Human Potential"
item.description:
It takes a village. @socraticainfo

of late nights, and people who say they want to do something, do it, and make it so phenomenal that every moment is awe-inducing.

of hosts around the world who cultivate the good vibes and community needed to unlock human potential. pic.twitter.com/CVPMMX2OOO

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) April 3, 2024

item.title: Celebrating Genuine Connections Over Past Achievements
item.description:
what i love most about socratica is that we don’t judge people based on their past accomplishments, degrees, work, fellowships, awards.

we watch and notice how people show up. the sparkle in their eyes. the ones who want to be there and want to help. https://t.co/9UV6ye9Cy4

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) August 25, 2024

item.title: Choose Your Own Definition of Success
item.description:
Doing the hard mental work to discover what is important to me > Taking the "easy" path and stealing someone else’s definition of success.

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) August 31, 2024

item.title: Tips to Host Successful Gatherings on a Budget
item.description:
If you want to host more, but these are holding you back:
- remember, 2 people is a hangout!
- focus on the people who come, not the people who don’t
- choose low-cost, high-fun formats (walks! do a puzzle, youtube karaoke)
- share the load (potlucks, find a co-host)

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) January 12, 2025

item.title: Breaking Barriers: Social Rules for Connection at Events
item.description:
My favourite part of hosting events is setting social rules that break barriers to connection.

Simple things like: "You’re allowed to invite yourself into conversations—I’ll be disappointed if you don’t"

It works every time and it boggles my mind.

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) January 10, 2025

item.title: "Show Appreciation as an Event Attendee"
item.description:
And if you are an attendee, show that you care!

Help set up and clean up. Show your excitement. Even shooting a quick text to say you had fun goes a long way.

Help make the host want to host again.

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) January 12, 2025

item.title: "Escape the Status Game by Embracing Diverse Perspectives"
item.description:
If you want to escape the status game, surround yourself with different types of peoples doing different things across all types of axis.

serious, silly, technical, big, small, inspiring, boring, engineering, art, unconventional, cliché, etc. https://t.co/KCVSw3ttzj

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) January 14, 2025

item.title: "Exploring Focus: Micro-Projects for Self-Discovery This Week"
item.description:
i’ve been feeling unfocused recently, so i’m using this week to explore.

one micro-project each day of the week.

i’ll be documenting what feels easy and what feels hard. learning more about myself and what feels like the path of least resistance.

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) January 19, 2025

item.title: Overcoming Hesitations to Host Events: Key Reasons Explained
item.description:
As a serial event host (100+ events: coworking, open mics, parties, you name it), the top reasons i see people hesitant to host:

1. Social risk: fear of rejection, wanting it to be perfect.

2. Burnout: cost, time, and effort that go unappreciated and unreciprocated https://t.co/M6a9gyO5MB

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) January 12, 2025

item.title: Exploring New Directions Reveals What Matters Most
item.description:
When you expose yourself to different directions, you start to see what is possible and give yourself the space to be drawn towards what you care about.

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) January 14, 2025

item.title: "Tangerine: Out of Place or Perfectly At Home?"
item.description:
A tangerine in a bowl of clementines feels out of place.

A tangerine in a fruit salad is right at home.

— Jake ⁂ (@JakeSRudolph) January 14, 2025
